This interface is to be used without the :0 or :1. The Node Manager's scripts traverse the different:X enabled IPs to determine which to add or remove. textBeforeTable: Table 5-7 Configuring Managed Servers In the Configure Managed Servers screen, add the following managed servers: Verify that the UDD settings are UDD for UMSJMSSystemResource, SOAJMSModule, and BPMJMSModule. Click Next. SSL enabled: leave unchecked SSL listen port: N/A Listen Port: 7001 Listen Address: Enter the hostname for the VIP0 virtual IP Name: AdminServer In the Configure the Administration Server screen, enter the following values: Managed Servers, Clusters and Machines JMS Distributed Destinations Administration Server In the Select Optional Configuration screen, select the following: In the Test JDBC Data Sources screen, the connections are tested automatically. The Status column shows the results. Ensure that all connections were successful. If not, click Previous to correct your entries. Click Next when all the connections are successful. Click Next. Update each schema: select one data source at a time and add the appropriate details. Ensure that the information is entered for all schemas: SOA Infrastructure, User Messaging Service, OWSM MDS Schema, and SOA MDS Schema. For a multi data source, click Add. Enter details for Oracle RAC instances. Oracle recommends that you use SCAN addresses to specify the host and port for both
textAfterTable: Do not delete any server that appears. You can modify the servers. If you delete a server and add a new one, targeting fails. Note: Although the standard recommendation is to run custom applications and other systems in a separate WebLogic Managed Server, the creation of the custom WLS managed servers described in Figure 5-41 is not addressed here. Click Next. In the Configure Clusters screen, add the following cluster: Name: SOA_Cluster Cluster Messaging Mode: unicast Multicast Address: N/A Multicast Port: N/A Cluster Address: Leave empty Click Next. In the Assign Servers to Clusters screen, assign the following servers to SOA_Cluster: WLS_SOA1 WLS_SOA2 Click Next. In the Configure Machines screen: Delete the LocalMachine that appears by default. Click the Unix Machine tab, and add the following machines: Table 5-8 Configuring Machines Name Node Manager Listen Address SOAHOST1 Hostname of SOAHOST1 SOAHOST2 Hostname of SOAHOST2
